alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Volusia County through 315 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ormond-By-the-Sea, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ormond-By-the-Sea and Ormond Beach Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
